name: Acceptance Criteria - The production plan must demonstrate that the production capacity and the hot storage capacity of the mixing plant is sufficient to supply asphalt to complete the work undertaken within any work period on time.
Reference Documents - AECOM – MAPMP 2.0 DP1 Spec. Cl 14.13.15.1
Responsibility - FH Project Engineer / Contract Administrator / Principal’s Design Consultant

Acceptance Criteria - Calibrating all necessary devices and parameters at the mixing plant to achieve the “Job Mix”. Established plants must provide historical records of the asphalt production over the previous one (1) month to verify consistency.

Frequency - Prior to commencing construction trial
Acceptance Criteria - Successful trial of asphalt production with the mixing plant where the asphalt produced shows that the mix complies to the specification requirements.

Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor must subject all the placing, compaction and finishing equipment and operating and supervisory personnel proposed for use on the Works to a trial using the construction procedures proposed for the Work.

Responsibility - FH Project Engineer / Contract Administrator / Principal’s Design Consultant

Frequency - Every delivery of bitumen to the mixing plant
Acceptance Criteria - All samples of bitumen must be obtained in accordance with Appendix B of AS 2008.
○ The samples shall consist of two (2) 0.5 litre (minimum) sealed containers labelled appropriately identifying the relevant lot and traceability to the source.
○ These samples to be submitted to the Contract Administrator / Principal’s Design Consultant.
Reference Documents - AECOM – MAPMP 2.0 DP1 Spec. Cl 14.17.5
Inspection / Test Method - AS 2008 Appendix B Verify
Record of conformity - This ITP signed / Aconex Correspondence

Frequency - At the end of each production shift

Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor shall determine the average bitumen content of each size of asphalt produced during each continuous mixing period or shift based on the total quantity of bitumen used and total asphalt produced.
○ Average bitumen content must be not less than the bitumen content of the “job mix” (Job Mix Bitumen Content is 5.5%).
Reference Documents - AECOM – MAPMP 2.0 DP1 Spec. Cl 14.13.15.7, 14.14.8, Table 14-14 Job Mix Formula as submitted in FHPL- GCOR- 000464
